me.prettyprint.hom
Class EntityManagerImpl

java.lang.Object
  me.prettyprint.hom.EntityManagerImpl

public class EntityManagerImpl
extends Object

Handles entity management by scanning classpath for classes annotated with Entity and providing basic load and save methods.

Author:

Method Detail

initialize

public void initialize(String[] classpathPrefixArr)
Initialize the manager by scanning the classpath starting with the classpathPrefix, looking for classes annotated with Entity. If an Entity class is found, it looks for the Table annotation to determine the Cassandra column family name.

Parameters:
classpathPrefixArr -
See Also:

find

public <T,I> T find(Class<T> clazz,
                    I id)
Load an entity instance. If the ID does not map to a persisted entity, then null is returned.

Type Parameters:
T - The type of entity to load for compile time type checking
I - Type of the entity's ID
Parameters:
clazz - The type of entity to load for runtime instance creation
id - ID of the instance to load
Returns:
instance of Entity or null if can't be found

find

public <T> T find(Class<T> clazz,
                  Object id,
                  me.prettyprint.hector.api.beans.ColumnSlice<String,byte[]> colSlice)
Load an entity instance given the raw column slice. This is a stop gap solution for instanting objects using entity manager while iterating over rows.

Type Parameters:
T - The type of entity to load for compile time type checking
Parameters:
clazz - The type of entity to load for runtime instance creation
id - ID of the instance to load
colSlice - Raw row slice as returned from Hector API, of the type ColumnSlice
Returns:
Completely instantiated persisted object
